Hail Leontius the brave soldier, the true fighter of Jesus Christ. Your name has spread throughout the world like that of St.Â George the saint of Melti. You rejected the false world and confessed (your faith) in the name Christ. You healed the sick and exorcised demons because of Godâ€™s gift that was always with you. What a great miracle you worked for the prince when you saved him. Who could count the many miracles that happened on the day of the consecration of your church! Your pure name is always in our mouths, sweet like honey. Christ crowned you with incorruptible crowns in His kingdom.

All the pure martyrs rejoice in you and praise you in heavens and on earth. All heavenly hosts rejoice in the struggle that you fought in the name of Christ. For this, our Savior took you to His kingdom and granted you the blessings that no eye has seen.

Give forth fruit becoming of repentance so that I might baptize you. The axe is at the root of the tree, and every bad tree will be cut down, and every good tree will be nurtured and pruned so that it gives forth fruit. Blessed are you, better than all the saints, O John, friend of the Bridegroom, who performed acts of power and gifts of healing through your body as a glorification of the Trinity. You healed the sick, exorcised demons, and restored the lost to faith in Christ. You used to say: "He who comes after me was before me, for He is truly earlier than me."

and baptized our Savior in the water of the Jordan, and saw the Holy Spirit descending upon Him and heard the voice of the Father crying and saying: "This is my beloved Son with whom IÂ am pleased." You are the promise of heaven, the angel of good tidings, the adornment of the wildernesses and the joy of the Jordan. You are the rooster who crowed before the rise of the light from the East delighting the souls of those who hear its voice. The luminous lantern is John the Forerunner who came before the Lord to prepare his ways, crying and saying: "IÂ am not the Christ, for He comes after me. It is he who is stronger than me." He rebuked Herod the hypocrite, head of the quarter, because of the wife of his brother. He ordered his head be severed. He completed his seeking and died for the truth, and received the crown of the everlasting life.

When it was the feast of the holy, virginal Nativity, she came to the church and wanted to enter it, but the doorman and the bishop prevented her. She wept and said to the bishop: "I repent of all my sins." But he said: "I will not believe you unless you bring me all your adornments and jewelry so that I might burn them in fire before you, and unless you become a nun." She hastened and brought all her money, and he burned it in her presence and cut her hair and put on her the holy habit of monasticism. She pushed herself in ineffable asceticism, and she reposed pleasing Christ.

Ù?Ø£Ù†Ø§ Ø£Ø¯Ø¹Ù‡Ù… ÙŠØ¹Ø°Ø¨ÙˆÙ†Ùƒ Ø¨Ø£Ø¹Ø¸Ù… Ø§Ù„Ø¹Ø°Ø§Ø¨ ÙˆØ§Ù„Ø¹Ù‚Ø§Ø¨ Ø¥Ù„Ù‰ Ø£Ù† ØªØªØ®Ù„Ù‰ Ø¹Ù† Ø¹Ø¨Ø§Ø¯ØªÙ‡ØŒ ÙˆØªØ±Ù?Ø¹ Ø§Ù„Ø¨Ø®ÙˆØ± Ù„Ù„Ø¢Ù„Ù‡Ø©."

He handed him over to a deputy of his to be tortured day and night, and ordered him not to have compassion upon him or mercy. He stayed with him for a year while torturing him with every kind of torture. He punished him every day. Then he threw him into the blazing fire. He stood in the midst of the fire, praising God and singing hymns to Him, like the three saintly youths. Because of this miracle, many believed in Christ, became martyrs, and received the incorruptible crown. He came out of the fire with his face joyous like someone who has come out of an aromatic garden. When the deputy tired of his punishment, he ordered his holy head be severed and he completed his honorable struggle. He received the heavenly crown of Jesus Christ and rejoiced with the martyrs in the region of the living.

ÙˆÙ„Ù… ØªØ­Ø±Ù…Ù‡ Ø³Ø¤Ø§Ù„ Ø´Ù?ØªÙŠÙ‡ Ø§Ù„Ø°ÙŠ Ù‡Ùˆ Ø¬Ù‡Ø§Ø¯ Ø§Ù„Ø´Ù‡Ø§Ø¯Ø© Ø§Ù„Ù…Ù‚Ø¯Ø³.

First were the abundant blessings of Christ, while he was in the midst of severe suffering. You gave his heart understanding and he chastises the kings. You strengthened his body and he tolerated the suffering. And when he completed his holy struggle, you placed upon him a crown of precious stones. He asked you for life, and you gave him everlasting life in the heavenly kingdom, and long days forever and ever, that is, his holy commemoration which you made everlasting. You dressed him with glory and splendor, that is, Your holy cross which he wore. You made him rejoice with (seeing) Your face, that is, the joy that is in your kingdom. He praised and sang hymns to your great power and the pure heavenly honors.

Ø¥Ø° Ù‡Ùˆ Ø¬Ù†Ø¯ÙŠ Ø´Ø¬Ø§Ø¹ Ù„Ø±Ø¨Ù†Ø§ ÙŠØ³ÙˆØ¹ Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø³ÙŠØ­ØŒ Ø§Ù„Ù‚ÙˆÙŠ Ù?ÙŠ Ø§Ù„Ø­Ø±ÙˆØ¨ Ø³ÙŠÙ†ÙˆØ³ÙŠ Ø§Ù„Ø´Ù‡ÙŠØ¯.

With wisdom and understanding he hoped for grace, healing and salvation from our Lord on the day of His coming again. He cried out before the hypocrite governors, saying to them: "IÂ am a Christian, a believer in Jesus Christ." The defiled hypocrites tortured him, and poured out his blood because of Christ, whom he loved. Truly, he became an inheritor of the kingdom of heaven along with the hosts of saints; the adornment of his pure soul has come to be with the Lord in his throne in the region of the living. For his stature has risen, all coolness and repose he attained from the Lord. He rejoices to the end of ages with the heavenly hosts. This is the pure, honorable martyr, who because of his firm faith saved the oppressed and healed the cast down.

of the Orthodox Christians and opened the churches of the followers of Arius. He arrested him, punished him, and imprisoned him until his return from the war. This saint prophesied: "You will be burned with fire by the hands of your enemies." The king and his eminent soldiers were burned in one of the villages. The followers of Arius and all the believers truly realized the greatness of his holiness. They released him from imprisonment and went down bowing to him and confessed in the Son of God, that He is co-essential in essence with His good Father. This blessed one was reposed and departed to the heavenly places of repose.

in a holy monastery in the vicinity of the East, fighting the evil spirits until he became a martyr without the shedding of his blood. When he rebuked the king and the followers of Arius, James the Confessor wanted to become a martyr. The Lord protected him for our benefit and so that the people might be edified. Who could count the wars from the enemy that our father James patiently endured! These were not with flesh and blood but with dominions and the powers of the dark world and with the evil spirits.

He healed the sick and exorcised demons, and raised the dead with the power of Christ. Thus, God dressed him in the unchanging habit in the everlasting kingdom of heaven, for he offered his soul as an acceptable, rational offering to Christ. St.Â Theodore, you gave up yourself for the orthodox faith. Who is like you among the martyrs, for you received many toils from the adversaries, and you, our father Theodore, became an example for all martyrs in your holy struggle. You completed your struggle patiently and your members were severed one by one. O bearer of the struggle, your name is forever in the heavens and on earth forever.

You vanquished all [the adversaries], by spreading your arms like the sign of the cross. When you confessed before the followers of Arius and George the hypocrite, he who did not deserve the priesthood, he punished you with many punishments, and tied you to the horses until your members were torn piece by piece. Truly blessed are you Christâ€™s martyr, the triumphant soldier, and feared fighter. Our Lord Jesus Christ granted you, through His abundant mercy, many ineffable gifts, and gave you three crowns, adorned with precious stones, of whose honor no corporeal tongue could speak: one for the pure faith, another for monasticism, and another for your blood which was poured out for the sake of Christ our God. You rejoiced with the martyrs in the heavenly Jerusalem, where there is no sadness, no wailing, and no crying.

great miracles, and countless gifts of healing through his body. He healed the sick, those with all kinds of afflictions, exorcised demons, and raised the dead. You Abaskhiroun showed your power to the thieves, who were unaware of it, when you appeared to them and tormented them with many threats. You prepared your soul as a true offering to Jesus Christ, and you were worthy of His glory. Because of the greatness of your joy in Christ, you gave your body over to great torture. Therefore, Christ crowned you with the incorruptible crown in His everlasting kingdom.

Hail Abaskhiroun the strong prince, the struggler, and the good fighter.
Ø§Ù„Ø³Ù„Ø§Ù… ÙŠØ§ Ø£Ø¨Ø§ Ø¥Ø³Ø®ÙŠØ±ÙˆÙ† Ø§Ù„Ø£Ù…ÙŠØ± Ø§Ù„Ù‚ÙˆÙŠ Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø¬Ø§Ù‡Ø¯ ÙˆØ§Ù„Ù…Ø­Ø§Ø±Ø¨ Ø¬ÙŠØ¯Ø§Ù‹.

Hail to you bearer of the crown that is made of precious stones and jewels, who belongs to the people of heaven, companion of the pure martyrs. Your name is Abaskhiroun, Godâ€™s acceptable grace, for you gave your soul and body as an offering to the Lord God, and surrendered your body to the fire and to travails and severe torture before the kings for the sake of Christ and did not reject Him. Jesus Christ, Son of God, was on your right hand, saving you and strengthening you until you completed your struggle. He consoled your soul, saying to you: "Come my blessed one, inherit everlasting life." He gave you dominion to trample over serpents and scorpions, and upon all power of the evil enemy. Pure martyr, the tongues of all the believers speak of your honor, because of the powerful acts you performed. You fought well for the orthodox faith, and Christ crowned you with all glory and honor.

ÙˆÙ‚Ø§Ù„ Ù„Ù‡: "Ù‚Ù… Ø¨Ø³Ø±Ø¹Ø© Ø®Ø° Ø§Ù„ØµØ¨ÙŠ ÙˆØ£Ù…Ù‡ ÙˆØ£Ù‡Ø±Ø¨ Ø¥Ù„Ù‰ Ù…ØµØ±."

Joseph rose and took the Virgin and the child with her and Salome the elder, and came down to Egypt and went to Kaskam. They stayed there until the death of Herod. The angel of the Lord appeared to Joseph, and commanded him to return to Nazareth. On their return, they drew near Al-Mahammah, where the Lord caused a spring of water to well up, which remains until this day at that place, healing everyone that uses it; there they get their fill from the blessing of the Virgin, Mother of the Savior, the All-Holy One, and the blessing of the Church which was built in her name. Her name lasts for all generations. Let us praise Christ, our true God, and glorify His Mother the Virgin.

The pure Archangel, Gabriel, the Annunciator, appeared to Joseph the carpenter in the dream saying: "Take the child and his mother, and go to the land of Egypt. Stay there until I let you know what happens." Joseph (rose) early and took the child and the Virgin and descended into the country of Egypt, towards the southern vicinities, in Upper [Egypt], (and stayed) until the evil mighty Herod died. They returned, upon the orders of the Archangel Gabriel. On their return they passed by the city of Cairo. They stayed in the holy cave that is at the Church of Abba Sergius, and also at Al-Mahammah that Christ made, where the spring of the water that heals every sickness. Let us glorify our Savior, who took for Himself human form so that he might save man from death and corruption.

God bestowed on her this great prophet, the anointer of kings. He stayed with her three years, and she presented him to the Temple of the Lord God, where he served Eli the Priest of the Lord. When the latter died, his soul multiplied upon him, and the Pantocrator spoke with him through inspiration many times, and ordered him to anoint Saul, son of Kish, a king over Israel. He also anointed David, son of Jesse, a king over the people of God. He was reposed, pleasing to God all the days of his life with true purity and justice. He antedated the coming of our Savior by one thousand thirty-five years.

This saint realized firmly the idols that he served could not do that, that they would burn if they were thrown into the blazing fire,

Ù?Ø¥Ù† Ù‡Ø°Ø§ Ø§Ù„Ù‚Ø¯ÙŠØ³ ØªØ¹Ø¬Ø¨ ÙˆØªØ­Ù‚Ù‚ Ø¨Ø«Ø¨Ø§Øª Ø£Ù† Ø§Ù„Ø£ÙˆØ«Ø§Ù† Ø§Ù„ØªÙŠ Ù‡Ùˆ ÙŠØ®Ø¯Ù…Ù‡Ø§ Ù„Ø§ ØªÙ‚Ø¯Ø± Ø£Ù† ØªÙ?Ø¹Ù„ Ù‡Ø°Ø§. ÙˆØ¥Ù† Ø·Ø±Ø­ÙˆÙ‡Ø§ Ù?ÙŠ Ø§Ù„Ù†Ø§Ø± Ø§Ù„Ù…ØªÙ‚Ø¯Ø© ØªØ­ØªØ±Ù‚.

but that God the Creator is the true God. Instantly, he cried: "I am Christian, I believe in Jesus Christ, Creator of everything." The hypocrite king arrested him, and rebuked him severely (saying): "How could you reject the service of the idols." He promised him good things if he yielded, but he did not pay attention to his threat, and did not fear him. He tortured him severely with every kind of torture, [while] Christ our God, saved and redeemed him. He imprisoned him with four martyrs. He took them out of prison and threw them into the blazing fire. God rained upon them drenching rain, and the flames became like cool dew. He crucified the saint as a sign that he worshiped the Crucified One, and as for the four saints he severed their holy heads. And they all rejoiced with Christ in His heavenly kingdom. And they received the incorruptible crown and the everlasting life.

When the governor tired of their torture, he severed their heads with the sword, and they received the crowns from Christ, and rejoiced with Him in His kingdom.

Churches were opened with ineffable glory, and they celebrated on this day as a great feast for God, in the eleventh year of the reign of Constantine the king, and in the beginning of the patriarchate of our father Alexander, the saintly patriarch of the city of Alexan`dria, the pure virgin who was (patriarch) during his days. What corporeal tongue could speak of the great rejoicing what was among the believers and in all churches when they heard the decree of Constantine the king saying: "Close the doors of the temples, and open the doors of the churches. Close the doors of the houses of the demons and open houses of God." For this, God has raised him in the kingdom of heaven. Blessed are you Constantine, for you loved the faith. For this, God kept you alive in the region of the living.

Wisdom sprang forth from his heart like Solomon the wise in his understanding and heart. He was clothed and adorned with every beauty and splendor like Joseph before Pharaoh. When the hypocrite King Diocletian saw the greatness of his standing, he appointed him an honorable+ over the legions of his soldiers. He became a hero, a warrior, and a good fighter in the war. His repute was widespread in the land of the Romans and the Syrians and in the cities of the kingdom. Later, there was weeping, wailing with bitterness, and sighing in the palace of Theognosta for Claudius the beloved saint because the emperor sent him into exile in the country of Egypt.

The king could not do him harm before the people of his city, lest they refuse to stone him. Romanus the counselor suggested he send him to the city of Ansena to be killed there. Then, he ordered he be sent to Ansena to be tortured there by Arianus, and if he did not agree to raise incense to the idols, his head should be severed with the sword. St.Â Claudius, was strong in the orthodox faith in our Lord Jesus Christ and never yielded. The governor Arianus spoke with him many times; he then pierced him in the side with a spear that was in his hand. He completed his struggle on the eleventh day of Paone, and our Lord Jesus Christ took his blessed soul and gave it as an acceptable offering before His good Father. And he rejoiced with Him in His kingdom to the age of ages.

All perfection is beheld in its proper end: Heaven and earth may both pass away, but you Michael the archangel, are always serving the Lord. All the praises of the seekers of the Lord, you present before Christ the King. It is you who strengthened Joshua son of Nun, and made him victorious in the war. All the trees that are planted in the whole earth, their fruits are perfected through Michael. And through his prayers, God sends blessed rains and the waters of the river. Archangel, you are he who worships the Lord all the time supplicating before Him on behalf of our souls. Christ our Savior, we ask you to accept Michaelâ€™s intercessions on our behalf, and deal with us according to your compassion, and restore us another time to the paradise.

following him with rejoicing as he presents them to God, pleading along with them for the human race. All animals on the earth, all people and beasts, God saves them through the intercessions of Michael. Pure Archangel, truly, I do not tire and my tongue does not refrain from speaking your honor. O pure archangel, the beauty and splendor of your holy name delights our souls so that we speak of your honor. Behold the water of the sea rises to its limit through the intercessions of Michael, the great among the archangels. All the fruits of the earth, God perfects well through the intercessions of Michael, great among the Archangels. All saving parables were given to us from Christ through the intercessions of Michael the great among the Archangels. Let us worship the Father, and the Son, and the Holy Spirit, and honor Michael, great among the archangels.

He also is the one who appeared to the righteous Joseph in the dream and spoke with him, saying: "Do not fear Joseph, take your woman, for the one she will give birth to is of the Holy Spirit." He is the one who went to Zacharias, the priest, and brought him the good tidings of the birth of the Forerunner, saying: "I am Gabriel who is before God, He sent me to you to bring good tidings." He also is the one who appeared to the Magi in the dream and sent them on to their country, and commanded them not to go to Herod. He also is the one who appeared to Joseph in the dream, saying: "Rise, take the child and go to the land of Egypt. He also spoke with Joseph in Egypt, saying: Rise, take the child and Mary his mother, and go to the land of Israel, for those who want the childâ€™s soul have died."

And on this holy day, the blessed Abba John, the great, bishop of the city of Jerusalem, was reposed. He who because of his genuine knowledge and the purity of his soul Christ Jesus chose for the holy episcopacy. The enemy tempted him and seduced him with love for gold and silver, so much so that he even made vessels and placed them on his table. The great Epiphanius came to Jerusalem borrowed the golden vessels from him and [sold] and disbursed their worth on the poor. When our father John learned of this, he took hold of him in the church of the Sepulcher and said to him: â€œI do not give you leave to go until you give me what is mine.â€?

He ordered they be rained upon with spears and darts, but the arrows never touched them. He ordered they be thrown into a blazing furnace, and the fire be made fiercer for them. The Lord Jesus sent his angel and saved them from the midst of the fire. When he tired of torturing them, he ordered their heads be severed with the sword. And so they completed their martyrdom on the fourteenth day of the month of Paone. A group of people came from the city of Sa and took the holy body of St.Â Apakir, and built over it a beautiful church and decorated it with all beauty and splendor. People of Damenhour took the bodies of the three saints and shrouded them in good shrouds and kept them with them to receive their blessings.

They were handed over to the death in accordance with their own will alone. For this, they worthily received the incorruptible crown and rejoiced with their Creator Christ, for they poured out their blood in His blessed name. Christ, when these martyrs came to know that when You come in your manifestation, the second coming, you will crown the saints, they hastened with great earnestness and firm faith, and poured out their blood in order to receive the hope and life that is in Christ. For this, they were worthy of receiving the life everlasting. When these martyrs saw that transgressions had multiplied and saw that the wound had become great, they stepped forward with courage, as triumphant soldiers, and confessed (faith) in Christ, and saved their souls. They received many honors from Jesus Christ and rejoiced with all the saints in the region of the living.

She toiled walking and roaming the cities and all the villages until she came to Alexan`dria. They guided her to the prison. She went there wishing to see him. She saw him suffering severely, with his hands and legs in wood chains. She wept bitterly because of his great suffering, so much so that her tears ran like water. When her brother Mina saw her, he was surprised by her; how did she come to Alexan`dria? He said: "You came here, what do you seek, Thecla my sister, in this city?" She said: Mina my brother, "I came here to hear your sweet sayings one more time."

that a church be built in my name, and my body placed in it." When Thecla his sister heard this, she wept from the bottom of her heart. In all, she comforted her heart, until he completed his holy struggle. She shrouded him with great glory and took him to her house glorifying God. Many people gathered to it celebrating his feast three times a year.

W v/e~tafswpi n~oumatoi: n~ref] n~te Pi,~rictoc: oube Pidiaboloc ethwou: nem niourwou n~a~nomoc.
You, who became a fighting soldier of Christ against the evil Satan and the hypocrite kings.
ÙŠØ§ Ù…Ù† ØµØ§Ø± Ø¬Ù†Ø¯ÙŠØ§Ù‹ Ù…Ø­Ø§Ø±Ø¨Ø§Ù‹ Ù„Ù„Ù…Ø³ÙŠØ­ Ø¨Ø¥Ø²Ø§Ø¡ Ø¥Ø¨Ù„ÙŠØ³ Ø§Ù„Ø±Ø¯Ø¦ ÙˆØ§Ù„Ù…Ù„ÙˆÙƒ Ø§Ù„Ù…Ù†Ø§Ù?Ù‚ÙŠÙ†.

When your head was severed in the name of Jesus Christ, you ascended on high with joy, and you received the incorruptible crown. You saw the sky open, and the martyrs and saints being crowned by Christ in His kingdom; you girded yourself with every weapon of the Holy Spirit, and accepted with courage the suffering of torture. You were hopeful in the struggle, and your face was gleaming with joy. With the great gift of God that is with you, you left the soldiery behind you along with worldly pride, and thus inherited everlasting life with Christ. You sought what is from on high and minded those that are heavenly and loved the holy place where Christ is sitting. You exposed Satan and his evil demons, with your great patience and exalted worship. When the governor saw your great adherence [to the faith], he soon ordered your head be severed. Thus you wore the incorruptible crown of martyrdom, and arrived with Jesus Christ, and rejoiced in His kingdom.

Unlike other children you did not play, because of the flame of the spirit that was burning inside you. As for the cause of stubbornness that acts in our nature, you restrained it with the rein of asceticism. You reigned in the flesh and all its pains and desires. As it is written: "You crossed the fire and the water when you divested yourself of this trying age." As for fire, it is the flame of desire, and as for the water, it is the weight of this false life. Abba Nopher, the elect one, your holy memory, filled with aroma, deserves every honor. Hail to Abba Nopher the Anchorite, Godâ€™s blessed elect one. Hail to the star that shines greatly with virtues upon the world.

He who divested himself completely of the glory of this world for the sake of the sweetness of God that was in him,

Afcwtp naf e~ers~v/r: n~niy/rion hi p~safe: e~hote n~tef[ime: qen nirwous m~biwtikon.
and chose to accompany the beasts of the wilderness rather than take pleasure in temporal cares,
ÙˆØ¥Ø®ØªØ§Ø± Ø£Ù† ÙŠØ³ØªØµØ­Ø¨ ÙˆØ­ÙˆØ´ Ø§Ù„Ø¨Ø±ÙŠØ© Ø£Ù?Ø¶Ù„ Ù…Ù† Ø£Ù† ÙŠØªÙ†Ø¹Ù… Ø¨Ø§Ù„Ø¥Ù‡ØªÙ…Ø§Ù…Ø§Øª Ø§Ù„Ø²Ù…Ù†ÙŠØ©ØŒ

which drown man in humiliation and ruin, and blind the understanding from true knowledge. For this, he raised his prophetic voice, saying: "Because of this I fled and lived in the wilderness awaiting Him who saves me from the stormy one, the unsettling one, of the sea of this false life." Thus, with an alert mind and spiritual understanding, he put himself in [a state of] rest, that is to say, his mental deliberateness, and lifted himself above the wicked waves of evil, which sink (one) to the bottom in a flood of pains. Thus, he became indifferent to the belly that begets condemnation, for he sustained it with only the beans and grasses of the wilderness. With these, and through exertion, the body of man is made sound in order to be subjugated to the Holy Spirit in peace. And thus, he had hope in the spirit, and intended in his heart to live the life of ineffable joy.

Our father Abba Letson, you were worthy of many great gifts from Christ.

All the austere life of the monks and ascetic worship
ÙƒÙ„ Ø§Ù„Ø³ÙŠØ±Ø© Ø§Ù„ØµØ¹Ø¨Ø© Ø§Ù„ØªÙŠ Ù„Ù„Ø±Ù‡Ø¨Ø§Ù† ÙˆÙ†Ø³ÙƒÙŠØ§Øª Ø§Ù„Ø¹Ø¨Ø§Ø¯Ø©

could not reach the exceeding heights and travails of our father, Abba Letson.
Ù„Ù… ØªØ¨Ù„Øº Ø§Ù„Ø¹Ù„Ùˆ ÙˆØ£ØªØ¹Ø§Ø¨ Ø£Ø¨ÙŠÙ†Ø§ Ø§Ù„Ù‚Ø¯ÙŠØ³ Ø£Ù†Ø¨Ø§ Ù„Ø§ØªØµÙˆÙ† Ø§Ù„Ù…ØªØ²Ø§ÙŠØ¯Ø©.

For he was exalted high above the limits of humanity and became like the incorporeal (beings). All mankind marvels at him, for he died three times and Christ our Lord raised him. Who among the people could do this, but he who loves God with love like yours? You fulfilled the commandments of the gospel with perfection, in word and in deed. What greater love than this, to give yourself for your companion? Blessed are you our father Abba Letson, for you loved your companion more than yourself, and died three times for the love that is from Jesus Christ, whom you loved. You completed your pure life and rejoiced with Christ in His kingdom.

For you became a shining star illuminating the whole world because of the greatness of your virtues, exalted worships, and astounding wonders.

Great exalted honors you deserved from God. Three holy crowns He placed upon your head.
ÙƒØ±Ø§Ù…Ø§Øª Ø¹Ø¸ÙŠÙ…Ø© Ù…Ø±ØªÙ?Ø¹Ø© Ù‚Ø¯ Ø§Ø³ØªØ­Ù‚Ù‚ØªÙ‡Ø§ Ù…Ù† Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ØŒ ÙˆØ«Ù„Ø§Ø«Ø© Ø£ÙƒØ§Ù„ÙŠÙ„ Ù…Ù‚Ø¯Ø³Ø© ÙˆØ¶Ø¹Ù‡Ø§ Ø¹Ù„Ù‰ Ø±Ø£Ø³Ùƒ.

All the lives of the righteous upon the face of the earth did not reach your virtues and exalted worships.
ÙƒÙ„ Ø³ÙŠØ± Ø§Ù„Ø£Ø¨Ø±Ø§Ø± Ø§Ù„Ø°ÙŠÙ† Ø¹Ù„Ù‰ ÙˆØ¬Ù‡ Ø§Ù„Ø£Ø±Ø¶ Ù„Ù… ØªØ¨Ù„Øº Ø¥Ù„Ù‰ Ù?Ø¶Ø§Ø¦Ù„Ùƒ ÙˆØ¹Ø¨Ø§Ø¯Ø§ØªÙƒ Ø§Ù„Ø¹Ø§Ù„ÙŠØ©.

For you died three times in your struggle on earth, but the Lord raised you with ineffable power. All the human race ceased to speak and could not described your honor. You rose above humanity and stayed forty days and forty nights without eating or drinking at all. Our good Savior descended from heaven with his pure angels and raised you and consoled you. The seven Archangels came to you praising and singing hymns with David the Psalmist thus saying: "the righteous ones cried and God responded to them, and from all their toils, He saved them." Blessed are you, our father the great saint. Abba Letson. You deserved [to see] this great scene from Jesus Christ. You completed your struggle in ripe old age and rejoiced with the saints in the heavenly Jerusalem.

and lived in the wilderness for sixteen years, struggling with asceticism. The demons were burned because of his prayers and vigils every night. (Word of) His virtues reached our saintly father, the great archpriest Abba Peter. He brought him to the cell and made him a scribe. When our father the patriarch was reposed, God the Lover of Mankind, chose him in his place. The church was much illuminated through him, for his epistles reached all the countries. And when the days of his headship and service were completed, he was reposed from all his toils, and inherited, along with the patriarchs, the blessings of Christ Jesus.

Hail to the morning star which rose upon us, his people, from the East teaching us the commandments and fear of God. You kept the pure flock, the rational sheep of our Lord Jesus Christ, who entrusted you with it. Our blessed father, the great Abba Demian, truly, you deserved the throne of the great city of Alexan`dria, you whom the Holy Spirit made a preacher, so that you may delight the souls with spiritual joy. You completed your service well, which was given to you as a gift from Christ your God. You clothed yourself in righteousness as David, the righteous king, said in the holy psalm: "Your priests, O Lord my God, wear justice and your holy ones rejoice and delight."

And his star rose from the East and shone brightly, in the elect struggle of martyrdom. He despised the tortures until he attained the crown of the heavenly people. There was a youth named George the New, from the houses of Egypt. He desired to become a Christian, for his mother was Christian. He went out and got baptized in one of the churches at the hands of a saintly priest. When his affair became known, they arrested him and brought him to the governor. When he stepped onto the stage, he confessed (his faith) in Christ our God. He was tortured greatly, and later his holy head was severed. And so he received the heavenly crown and rejoiced with Christ in His kingdom.

When he was presented before him, the governor threatened him many times, and then tortured him severely. (Throughout the ordeal) Christ was consoling him and strengthening him.

Later, he gave his decree that his holy head be severed. A great crowd followed him from the city of Ansena. Among the crowd was a lion trainer of the governor Arianus (who went) to look at the pure martyr. He had two large strong lions with him, with iron chains around their necks and legs. One of them jumped and broke the chains and came to St.Â Pishoy Anoub to devour him, but the angel of the Lord raised St.Â Pishoy Anoub onto the lionâ€™s shoulder and flew up high with them, and brought them with the Lordâ€™s power to the middle of the city of Ain-Shams (Heliopolis) with the eyes of the saint blindfolded with rags. He completed his struggle in that city, and received the incorruptible crown of martyrdom. Jesus, our Savior, received his blessed soul, and presented it to His good Father as an acceptable sacrifice.

When Elijah was taken up to heaven, he accompanied him to the holy Jordan. When Elijah said to him, Ask me whatever you wish, he did not ask him for any of the possessions of this world nor for its treasures, but said with a humble heart, May your spirit be multiplied in me. And so, through God it happened to him as he had prophesied. And it was as he said, and the spirit of Elijah multiplied upon him. He performed his wonders and doubled them. That one crossed the sea once, and this one split the sea two times. Elijah raised one dead (person), but he raised two dead (persons). He fulfilled the prophecy and was reposed with all the prophets.

Truly, I am a poor person, and all the more in need, and do not reach the vastness of your true virtues, but as I honor you, O deserving of all honor, my lips stop talking, for I am unable to honor you. You who split the Jordan twice, like Elijah, his father, and like Moses, head of the prophets. You who through his prayers, enabled a barren woman to give birth to a son, and also raised him from the dead after his death. You are he who threw salt into the salty bitter water, changing it with your prayers into sweet (water) better than honey. You, who through his holy sayings, changed the water into good oil in the vessels of the poor, needy woman. If I were able to count the grains of sand upon the sea shore, I could also count your many wonders.

Well indeed, all prophecies of the prophets have been fulfilled in you. Well indeed, all the virgins loved purity because of St.Â Mary. Well indeed, all angelic hosts rejoice in Mary. Well indeed, Adam and his offspring have now been released (from slavery) through Mary. Well indeed, the fire of the divinity dwelt in Mary and her body did not burn. Well indeed, this virgin has become a palace for the Pantocrator. Well indeed, the patriarchs and the prophets spoke of her honor. Well indeed, Joachim and Anna gave birth to Mary, queen of women.

You breathed in their faces, and laid your hand upon their heads, and braced them with the power from on high, and (gave them) the authority to forgive sins, saying: â€œWhatever you bind on earth, remains bound in heaven, and whatever you loose on earth is loosed in heaven.â€? Zerubbabel made a tabernacle, similar to that which Moses saw on the mountain, which is like the tabernacle and the new Church that was consecrated in the name of the Virgin. David spoke of her honor, and the honor of the New Zion, and of the glory of the Church and the grace of Mary, Mother of God, saying: â€œI bless the Lord god in the many churches and sing hymns to Him in the springs of Israel.â€? Mary is the name of the church, the bride of Christ, which he built upon the rock, and our fathers the Apostles consecrated her. They made fast the foundation of the church. The prophets saw her and loved her. They called her my chosen church, and my perfect bride, and my pure dove, according to the saying of Solomon.

Ù„Ø³Ø§Ù† Ø£Ù†ØªÙŠÙ…ÙˆØ³ ÙˆØ§Ø¨Ø±Ø§Ø¨ÙŠÙˆØ³ ÙŠØªÙƒÙ„Ù…Ø§Ù† Ù…Ø¹ Ø¨Ø¹Ø¶Ù‡Ù…Ø§ Ù…Ù† Ø£Ø¬Ù„ Ø§Ù„Ø´Ù‡Ø§Ø¯Ø©.

They did not fear torture, but became strong in the wars. As for the hypocrite King Diocletian, he threw them into the furnace of the bath. Instantly, they cried out before the Lord God and the fire became like the cool dew. Many times he crushed them under the tillers, but they did not worry about the many tortures. Then, he severed their heads with the sword and they departed to the region of the living. During that time, after the oppression, the faithful built a great church for them, and it was consecrated on the twenty-second of Paone. Glory be to the Lord God and His pure martyrs. Great miracles and many wonders occurred through their bodies.

He sent a deputy of bestial temperament to the head of the soldiers of the city to bring the saints and to take responsibility for their torture. When the soldiers came they found the saints eating together with great thankfulness. St.Â Cosmas said to his brothers: "Let us rise from the earthly table to go to the one in the heavens." The saints got up and went to the deputy. On the way, they performed many wonders and great miracles. When they faced extreme torture, they confessed openly. The deputy punished them with great torture and suffering, and in the end severed their heads with the sword. With this they wore the crown of martyrdom and rejoiced with the angels in the region of the living.

Abanoub answered, saying: "This will never be, to leave behind me the God and bow to the idols, the stone and wood, which have no breath in it." He tortured him all the more then exiled him to the vicinities of the west. They put him in a cave, where he stayed until the reign of Constantine. He brought him to the city of Constantinople and revered and honored him. And thus, he returned to the mountain of Pashla facing his town where he stayed wearing an outfit of iron. They made him a priest, and he saw Christ upon the altar forgiving the sins of the penitents. Later, he was reposed, and departed to Christ, whom he loved.

Instantly, he heard: Be strong my beloved Abanoub, for I am with you beholding your struggle. I will make your name widespread in all the countries of the world, and will make this name widespread in all the generations to come." Jesus Christ, the Son of God, granted a gift to Abba Noub to heal the sick and exorcise the demons. Abanoub the Confessor has become a martyr because of the toils that he suffered and the excessive tortures. They put him in a cave for many years until God, the Lover of Mankind, favored the affairs of the Christians. Great Abanoub, truly, you have risen very high.

In accordance with Godâ€™s command, Abba Moses came to the holy mountain of Abba Macarius. When Abba Isidore met him he became fearful, for he was very tall like a mighty one, and his body was broad and strongly unbeatable. He spoke with him, testing him to see if he would reverse his position, saying: "We are oppressed by the devils. You cannot be with us. We suffer because of scarcity, we can barely meet our needs, and we have no pleasure from anywhere. Go, my son, to the land of Egypt, there you may live as you wish." Abba Moses pleaded with them, Abba Macarius and Abba Isidore, saying: "For the sake of God the Most High, accept me unto you, my saintly fathers, the true physicians."

One of them is Abba Moses the Black. He was a murderer, a glutton, and a drunk.
Ø§Ù„Ø°ÙŠÙ† Ù…Ù†Ù‡Ù… Ø£Ù†Ø¨Ø§ Ù…ÙˆØ³Ù‰ Ø§Ù„Ø£Ø³ÙˆØ¯ Ù„Ø£Ù†Ù‡ ÙƒØ§Ù† Ù‚Ø§ØªÙ„Ø§Ù‹ Ø£ÙƒÙˆÙ„Ø§Ù‹ Ø³ÙƒÙŠØ±Ø§Ù‹.

Jesus Christ chose him for the priesthood. He became a father to many according to the orders of the Lord. Many miracles and wonders, he performed through the Holy Spirit. He completed his seeking in ripe old age and departed accompanied by the elders to our father, Abba Macarius. He said: "One of you will become a martyr." Our father, Abba Moses said: "May I be he, my father, for he who kills with the sword, by the sword dies." The Barbarians came and killed him with seven of the brethren, for they did not want to flee, until they had received the incorruptible crown. One of them fled and hid. He looked and saw the angel of the Lord with the crown in his hands. Soon, he came out hurriedly before the Barbarians, and received the crown of life from the hand of the angel. My fathers, look and marvel! The thief, the degenerate, the robber, who never knew God, was baptized and became a monk and became a priest and wore the sign of the glorious Cross, and received the crown of martyrdom.

and built a church on it. He departed towards the vicinity of Edessa, where he healed Abger, the righteous king, and baptized him and confirmed him in the faith. He entered into the city of Arat. There he preached the pure faith and there baptized many people. The governor arrested him there and tortured him severely. He nailed shoes onto his feet and asked him to run about a mile, then he was hanged up and they shot him with arrows. He surrendered his soul into the hands of Christ after he wrote his epistle, which is the seventh of the catholicon.

You, who heard the joyous voice, saying: "Come to me, blessed of my Father the Pantocrator, inherit everlasting life with the saints who pleased Me in the heavenly Church." You, who worthily gave praise with David the psalmist, saying: "He raised me upon the rock, and honored my head." O you whom God proved a wise man, with understanding of heart, whose sayings reached the countries of the world. You whom Jesus Christ chose as archpriest, as He had chosen Paul the Apostle. You who became a successor of Mark the Evangelist in the city of Alexan`dria and in the vicinities of Ethiopia. You whom God filled with the Holy Spirit, like the Apostles, in action and in sayings of truth. Great shepherd, we ask your fatherhood to supplicate on our behalf before our Lord, Jesus Christ.

He, who was sent to all saints preaching to them of mysteries. Gabriel the angel was sent from God to a city in Galilee called Nazareth, to a virgin betrothed to a man named Joseph, from the house of David. The name of virgin who was betrothed to him was St.Â Mary. When he entered where she was with his wings full of aroma, he spoke with her with joy, saying: "Hail to you, full of grace, whom God loved and in whom God dwells for our salvation." Hail to Gabriel the elect herald. Hail to the head of all the hosts of all the angels. Hail to Gabriel, for whom they built a great church on the mountain of Nekloune.

Gabriel is the one who preached to the shepherds in the field, saying: "Unto you today a Son is born, a Savior, in Bethlehem.

Go with joy. Here is a sign for you: you will find a child swaddled in a manger." Gabriel is the one who appeared to St.Â Archelaos, Bishop of Pentapolis, and spoke with him, saying: "I am he, Gabriel, the great archangel, who appears to you so that you might build a church for me." Thus, a church was built for him on the mountain of Nekloune, and his feast was celebrated in it on the twenty-seventh day of Paone. This is He who pleads, along with the Mother of God St.Â Mary, on our behalf before God our Savior to forgive us our sins.

And on this holy day was the repose of the great among the prophets, the honorable Joshua son of Nun, obedient disciple of Moses, the praised prophet, giver of the pure Law and the arch prophet. Who could count the miracles and many wonders which he performed among the people of Israel, after Mosesâ€™ death? And God was with him supporting him in the wars; he restored the people and entered with them into the Land of Promise. When his days were completed, he was reposed in peace, and the people of Israel mourned him with great mourning.

When he laid his hand upon his eyes, he saw the light again. Through his pure hands, God performed great miracles and many wonders. Through his preaching many people, Jews and Gentiles, believed. Later, Lucianus arrested him. He beat him with painful beatings, and tortured him with severe punishments and scraped the skin on his sides and burnt him with torches lit aflame with burning fire. The Lord strengthened and supported him in all his toils. He took him outside the city wall and they stoned him for a long time. He surrendered his soul into Christâ€™s hand, and received the crown of martyrdom.

This martyr and struggler took his staff with him and went to the city of Alexan`dria, and confessed (faith) in Christ [Jesus our Savior].
ÙˆÙ‡Ø°Ø§ Ø§Ù„Ø´Ù‡ÙŠØ¯ Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø¬Ø§Ù‡Ø¯ Ø£Ø®Ø° Ù…Ø¹Ù‡ Ù?Ø±Ù‚Ù„ØªÙ‡ ÙˆÙ…Ø¶Ù‰ Ø¥Ù„Ù‰ Ù…Ø¯ÙŠÙ†Ø© Ø§Ù„Ø£Ø³ÙƒÙ†Ø¯Ø±ÙŠØ© ÙˆØ§Ø¹ØªØ±Ù? Ø¨Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø³ÙŠØ­ [ÙŠØ³ÙˆØ¹ Ù…Ø®Ù„ØµÙ†Ø§].

The governor offered him the worship of idols and to make him a scribe for himself. The saint got angry with him and struck with the staff. The soldiers seized him and tortured him severely. God sent the pure Archangel Michael. He saved him, strengthened him and healed him of his wounds. When they threw him in prison, the jailer asked him concerning his son who was sick, so that he might heal him. He gave him that staff. He placed the staff upon him, and he was healed. St.Â Thomas performed countless great miracles. The unbelievers put him in a cellar for fifteen days without food or water, while Michael consoled and strengthened him. Who could count the tortures this martyr suffered? When Arianus, the governor, was baffled by him, he ordered his head be severed. He wore the incorruptible crown of martyrdom, and rejoiced with Jesus Christ in His kingdom forever.

You who are exalted above the world like a luminous cloud. All your life, you did not tire of watering the vineyard of the Lord of hosts. With abundant rain you erased the adversaries and all the heresies of the blasphemers, for you struck them with blindness, with the lightning of the divine sayings. And with constant fruit-giving dew, you taught all the people, and from the depth of your heart, you expanded the knowledge in your pure people. For you delivered pure sayings from the depths of the scriptures, the breath of God. You became pure (free) from all the passions and a living icon of virtues.

With your true wisdom, you chastised the king who lacked understanding, when St.Â Abba Severus, the patriarch, was reposed, as arranged. Friend of the Apostles and martyr, you patiently endured the great exile to the end. You completed your seeking and kept the orthodox faith which our saintly fathers at Nicea established. Our God-worshiping teacher, Theodosius, the patriarch, who could speak of your great courage when you made your way to Julian, the king! The orthodox people were proud of you and pleased with you. In the beginning of his response, he honored your stature and presence before him. He wanted to mislead and to deceive you, like Satan his father, but you were firm and understood his false greeting until you put degraded his stature with your great patience. You completed your struggle with joy and delight, and rejoiced with the saints in the region of the living.

The angel of the Lord appeared to the two pure martyrs, St.Â Pasidi, who was a priest, and his brother, and ordered them to confess (faith) in Christ our God. They rose hurriedly towards the deputy. They found a ship with these five ascetics in it on their way to the governor. They agreed among themselves, with true love, and came to the deputy and confessed (faith) in Christ. He punished them severely with every kind of torture, and when the deputy tired of torturing them, he severed their heads and they received the heavenly crown in the Church of the first-born.

Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø¬Ø§Ù‡Ø¯ Ø£Ø¨Ø§Ù‡ÙˆØ±ØŒ ÙˆØ£Ø¨Ø§ Ø¨Ø´Ø§Ù‰ Ø§Ù„ØµØ¯Ù‘Ù?ÙŠÙ‚ØŒ Ø£Ø®ÙŠÙ‡ Ø¨Ø§Ù„Ø¬Ø³Ø¯ØŒ ÙˆØ£Ù…Ù‡Ù… Ø§Ù„Ù‚Ø¯ÙŠØ³Ø© Ø¯ÙŠØ¯Ø±Ø§.

If all the wise men on earth gathered in one place, they could not relate their honor, and the toils which they endured. When they grew in stature, they became frightening to Satan and his vile, evil, defiled demons, because of the greatness of their desire, and the zeal of their love for God, that is full of piety, in Christ the King. When they became soldiers, they loved the Lord with all their heart and the glory of this world could not separate them from Christ. When the persecution and the worship of idols started, they left behind them the soldiery, and all their rank and standing. They exposed Satan and his evil devils with their great patience and great worship. When the governor saw their great adherence (to the faith), he soon ordered their heads be severed. They wore the incorruptible crown of martyrdom, and they dwelt with Jesus Christ and rejoiced in His kingdom.

Among those born of women, none is like you, son of the elderly barren one, and kin of Christ. O Priest, son of the priest, and the confessor, who became a missionary and a preacher to all the nations, saying: "Repent, the kingdom of heaven is near." He was given the dominion to work great powers. Our Savior testifies of John the Forerunner, that no one, among those born of women is more exalted than him. For he was ahead and came before Him preaching everyone to know their creator, crying out and saying: "He who comes after me is stronger than me. He is the Savior of the world." Forerunner, the Baptist, you have risen so high, higher than the luminous star with your great luminosity. When you were in your motherâ€™s womb, while she pregnant with you, Christ the Son of God sanctified you.
